itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Denzil Jones (birth registered second ¼ 1926  – 25 December 2010), also known by the nickname of "Buck" (after actor Buck Jones), was a Welsh rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Taibach RFC and Aberavon RFC, as a prop, i.e. number 1 or 3, and club level rugby league (RL) for Wigan, as a prop, i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums.

response: * Aberavon RFC- Denzil Jones, James Jones, Matthew Bradley, Michael Kelly, Mark Fender
*Denzil Jones (1926–2010), Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer
